Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael A. Kirby was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation August 18, 2014 by 4:30 p.m., or August 19, 2014 by 12:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file balance payable through a payment plan with Clerk of Court.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
-Jail sentence to commence no later than August 29, 2014.
-With good time.
-Court grants Huber for work.
-Defendant may serve time in Dunn County Jail with no cost to St. Croix County.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Kaley Walker   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Michael A. Kirby appeared from jail. Probation Agent Tricia Gilby present. Case called at 1:59 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a sentencing hearing on revocation. Both parties received a copy of the revocation packet. ADA Walker did not find any corrections that need to be made. Atty Smestad did not find any corrections that need to be made. Does however address that the packet contains recommendations for 2 cases. One St Croix County and one Pierce County Case. State gives sentencing arguments. Atty Smestad gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 

Court orders:

TOTAL sentence of 4 years

- Bifurcated sentence of IC 2 years ES 2 years

- 358 days jail credit

- Eligible for challenge incarceration program and substance abuse program

- Payment of court costs and DNA Surcharge if not already paid

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while      this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Matthew L. Hartung. DF ATTY: Jens Hubert Loberg. DF:  Michael A. Kirby appeared.  Court called at 3:04 p.m.  ADA Hartung advises the court there is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

S/W 36 months probation with conditions
- AODA with follow through
- 30 months DL Revocations
- 30 months IID.
- 6 months jail sentence with good time
- Court grants huber for work.
- May serve time in Dunn County with no cost to St. Croix County
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Report to probation by 4:30 p.m. today (08/18/14) or by 12:00 p.m. by 08/19/14
- Jail sentence to begin no later then 08/29/14
- Court costs of $1719.00.  Apply bond on file.
- Court approves payment plan

20 days to appeal
Plea hearing on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on October 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on September 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on September 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
